murrambingi - You're welcome, and thanks for the feedback. I assure you that our only purpose is to produce the highest possible quality movies for their size, with AVCHD file/folder structure so that they can be burned to cheap media if so required. Everything we do is in accordance with that - nothing more, nothing less. Obviously, if you want to convert to a lower quality format to re-upload, that is your prerogative, and of course, any conversion will take time.

Not aimed at you in particular, but to the people that still don't understand aspect ratios/video resolution:-

If watched at full-screen, you will see black bars on a movie that has an aspect ratio of 2.35:1 whether they are cropped out of the video or not, because the movies simply weren't filmed to fit on most TV/monitor screens. Those mattes also do not add anything to a video's filesize, so if you are removing them for any reason, you are wasting your time.
